p: The spread of this new, poorly understood infection is indeed a challenge: as far as we know, contamination leads to an overt infection in about half of cases, with a wide range of signs and symptoms, from a mild flu-like illness, to a severe, potentially lethal pneumonia. As far as we presently know, re-infection is possible and contamination can occur in the pre-symptomatic stage or the disease can be transmitted by non-symptomatic carriers [ 2].
